item.title: Super Nintendo World Direct set for November 11
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/11/super-nintendo-world-direct-set-for-november-11

  • Nintendo

10 minutes in length. No game information.

Nintendo will host a Super Nintendo World Direct on November 11 at 2:00 p.m. PT / 5:00 p.m. ET, the company announced. You will be able to watch it on YouTube (America, Japan).

The live stream will be roughly 10 minutes in length and showcase Donkey Kong Country of Super Nintendo World at Universal Studios Japan. No game information will be featured.

item.title: Hello Neighbor 3 announced for PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/11/hello-neighbor-3-announced-for-pc

  • PC

Embark on a cozy yet eerie adventure.

tinyBuild has announced Hello Neighbor 3, the latest installment in the survival horror stealth franchise. PC (Steam) is currently on the only confirmed platform. A release date was not announced.

Hello Neighbor 3 is currently in active development by Hello Neighbor franchise creator Nikita Kolesnikov and a small team of developers, and is following the development approach of the first game.

“Really excited to keep the development of the Hello Neighbor 3 in an open format, sharing our journey,” said Kolesnikov in a press release. Fingers crossed, early alphas will soon be available to try out!”

  • ❮
  • ❯

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

A cozy yet eerie adventure, where every path is the right one, and every action leads to discovery. Explore and influence Raven Brooks, a half-abandoned town simulated in real-time.

Arriving in Raven Brooks as a stranger with no ties to this place, you find yourself in a forgotten, half-abandoned town where every citizen has relations, desires, and goals. Your actions will ripple through the town, changing the course of events…

Key Features

  • Simulated Town – Raven Brooks as a sandbox simulated in real-time. Residents act based on their personalities and circumstances.
  • Every Decision is the Right One – The system-based nature of the game allows for complex ways of achieving your goals.
  • Cozy Yet Eerie Adventure – A fading half-abandoned town in early spring, tangled with overgrowth and memories.

Watch the first developer log below. View the first screenshots at the gallery.

Developer Log #1

item.title: This Week’s Japanese Game Releases: Dragon Quest III HD-2D Remake, LEGO Horizon Adventures, more
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/11/this-weeks-japanese-game-releases-dragon-quest-iii-hd-2d-remake-lego-horizon-adventures-more

  • PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Quest
  • Smartphone
  • Switch
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

Beyblade X: XONE, Debut Project: Cooking Cafe, Rage of the Dragons NEO, Tetris Forever, etc.

Dragon Quest III HD-2D Remake for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch, and PC, and LEGO Horizon Adventures for PlayStation 5, Switch, and PC are the highlights of this week’s Japanese video game releases.

Other new titles due out this week include Beyblade X: XONE and Debut Project: Cooking Cafe for Switch and PC, and Rage of the Dragons NEO and Tetris Forever for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC.

Get the full list of this week’s Japanese game releases below. It should be noted that Gematsu will receive a small percentage of money from purchases made through Play-Asia links. You can also save five percent with our multi-use “GEMATSU24” coupon code.

Physical and Digital

  • Beyblade X: XONE (Switch)
  • Core Keeper (PS5, PS4, Switch) – Already available worldwide.
  • Debut Project: Cooking Cafe (Switch) – Launching digitally worldwide.
  • Dragon Quest III HD-2D Remake (PS5, Switch) – Launching worldwide.
    • North American Version (PS5, Xbox Series, Switch)
    • European Version (PS5, Xbox Series, Switch)
    • Asian Version (PS5, Switch)
  • LEGO Horizon Adventures (PS5, Switch) – Launching worldwide.
    • North American Version (PS5, Switch)
    • European Version (PS5, Switch)
    • Asian Version (PS5, Switch)
  • Minecraft (PS5) – Already available worldwide.
  • Potion Permit: Complete Edition (PS5, Switch) – Already available worldwide.
  • Q and Q2 Physical Edition (Switch)
  • Suika Game Special Edition (Switch)
  • UFO Robot Grendizer: The Feast of the Wolves (Switch) – Already available worldwide.
    • Collector’s Edition (Switch)

Digital-Only

  • Beyblade X: XONE (PC [Steam])
  • Debut Project: Cooking Cafe (PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Dragon Quest III HD-2D Remake (Xbox Series, PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Heretic’s Fork (PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, Switch) – Launching worldwide.
  • I Am Future (PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • In Sink (PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • LEGO Horizon Adventures (PC [Steam, Epic Games Store]) – Launching worldwide.
  • MONPIC: The Hatchling Meets a Girl (Switch, PC [Steam], iOS, Android) – Launching worldwide.
  • Nephise: Ascension (PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One) – Launching worldwide.
  • NINJA KAMUI: SHINOBI ORIGINS (PS4) – Launching worldwide.
  • Petit Island (PS5, Xbox Series, Switch, PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
    • North American Version (PS5, Xbox Series, Switch)
    • European Version (PS5, Xbox Series, Switch)
  • Rage of the Dragons NEO (PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, Switch, PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • The Rise of the Golden Idol (PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, Switch, PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Skydance’s BEHEMOTH (PS VR2, PC [SteamVR], Quest 2, Quest 3) – Launching worldwide.
    • North American Version (PS VR2)
  • Songs of Conquest (PS5, Xbox Series) – Launching worldwide.
  • Songs of Silence (PS5, Xbox Series, PC [Steam, GOG]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Sorry We’re Closed (PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Stunt Paradise (PS5, PS4) – Launching worldwide.
  • Temtem: Swarm Early Access (PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Tennis Elbow 4 (PS4) – Launching worldwide.
  • Tetris Forever (PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, Switch, PC [Steam, GOG]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Who Needs a Hero (PS5, PS4) – Launching worldwide.

The PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, and Switch titles listed above can be purchased through Japanese PlayStation Network and Nintendo accounts using prepaid cards:

  • PlayStation Store cards (yen): 1,100 / 3,000 / 5,000 / 10,000
  • Nintendo eShop cards (yen): 1,000 / 1,500 / 3,000 / 5,000 / 9,000

item.title: Aquaplus announces new RPG project kizuna
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/11/aquaplus-announces-new-rpg-project-kizuna

Aquaplus has announced project kizuna, a brand-new RPG currently in development. Platforms and a release date were not announced.

The game’s staff includes:

  • Producer: Naoya Shimokawa
  • Director: Kengo Uchibori (Previous works: I Am Setsuna, GOKEN)
  • Scenario: Munemitsu Suga (Previous works: Utawarerumono series)
  • Character Design: Tatsuki Amazuyu and Misato Mitsumi (Previous works: Utawarerumono series, ToHeart2)

Here is the first piece of concept art:

Further information was not announced.

item.title: ToHeart remake launches in spring 2025 in Japan for Switch, PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/11/toheart-remake-launches-in-spring-2025-in-japan-for-switch-pc

  • PC
  • Switch

Characters depicted in full 3D.

The remake of romance adventure game ToHeart will launch for Switch and PC via Steam in spring 2025 in Japan, developer Aquaplus announced.

Get the latest details below.

As one of Aquaplus’ flagship titles, ToHeart gained popularity as a school romance story adventure game. It has been expanded to various forms of media, including a TV anime, and a sequel was also released. Today, a newly reborn ToHeart with characters rendered in full 3D was formally unveiled.

The following information was also announced:

  • Staff
    • Character Design: Tatami Honjou (Tatami Juujou)
  • Cast
    • Akari Kamigishi (voiced by Kana Ichinose)
    • Multi (voiced byHina Youmiya)
  • Opening Theme Song
    • Title: “Feeling Heart”
    • Lyrics: Naoko Sutani
    • Composition: Naoya Shimokawa
    • Arrangement: Naoya Shimokawa and Junya Matsuoka
    • Vocals: YURiKA
  • Product Specifications
    • Release Window: Spring 2025 (Japan)
    • Platforms: Switch, PC (Steam)
    • Price:
      • Digital: 2,800 yen (3,080 yen with tax)
      • Physical (Switch): 3,980 yen (4,378 yen with tax)

Further information was not announced.

View the first screenshots at the gallery.

Screenshots

  • ❮
  • ❯
